Evaluation and bias

Evaluation is how you earn trust. Bias is a risk to safety, fairness, and credibility. Both are business and governance concerns, not only technical ones.

1. What are you optimising for?

Evaluation rubric

  • Measure time saved and user satisfaction.
  • Track error cost, not only error rate.
  • Design a workflow that recovers from mistakes.

2. Bias and oversight factors

Base-rate gap between groupsMedium
Label noiseLow
Impact severity if wrongHigh

Interpretation

  • Accuracy measures correctness on a dataset. Usefulness measures value in a workflow.
  • Bias and fairness risks often show up as different error rates across groups or contexts.
  • Testing AI systems means testing data pipelines, prompts, and monitoring, not only the model.

This lab avoids heavy maths. In practice you would still run real subgroup and drift tests.

Accuracy vs usefulness

A system can be accurate and still harmful, if it is applied to the wrong task or used without safeguards.
